posts.cooked: Hi there! I’m a new frc member and I’m looking for a way to learn programming in java easier. I tried WPILib but it’s very hard for me to comprehend almost anything written there. Does anyone have any alternatives they can share? Thanks in advance.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Labview .

XD

(Labview has mostly fallen out of favor in frc)

Edit: i would start with some frc explainer videos (don’t have links atm sorry, but a quick serarch on this forum should get you some recent options) reading and using documentation is a VERY important part of being a competent coder (and later software engineer/ developer if you decide to go that route) it is an important skill to learn and takes practice.

As a visual person myself, well written documentation started to feel more visual at a certain point. Add in an IDE, some code standard practices (i.e. naming conventions) and some creature comforts (i.e. formatters, linters, often in IDEs)… then text rapidly becomes visual.

posts.name: Cole Hunt
posts.cooked: Are you trying to learn Java or how to program a FRC robot?

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: In addition to the important question above, what does “visual” mean to you?  Programming is not a discipline that lends itself to a lot of pictures, illustrations, diagrams, graphics, etc.  There are places where flowcharts or logic diagrams come in, but there’s a lot of programming where that doesn’t really apply.

posts.name: Bryce Hanson
posts.cooked: Maybe something like a video tutorial could be helpful? Though it’s now a little out of date, 0 to Autonomous could be a good place to start.

posts.name: Prince M
posts.cooked: I second this, it’s what got me started on understand the daunting amount of stuff to learn in WPILib. That series and the docs were my best friend.
my bad for not being clear about that, I’m learning how to program a robot

posts.name: Cole Hunt
posts.cooked:
That’s a lot harder to make suggestions for. There is a good resource for a lot of videos and tutorials that someone put together.

FRC Java Programming Resource Compendium Official WPILIB System Documentation +++ https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/ +++ Development Environment Development Environment Installation Instructions:...

The other thing is, there is a lot of stuff WPILib can do, but a lot of it is not needed for simple robot operation. I would start small with the basics like subsystems (and commands if you want to do command based) and then begin looking into other features when you start more advanced projects.

From the very short looking I did 3847 Intro to Programming stuff looks good Spectrum FRC Training Curriculum
